dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1505 EH: No Stolen Trademarks Honored in America Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To modify the prohibition on recognition by United States courts of certain rights relating to certain marks, trade names, or commercial names.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Stolen Trademarks Honored in America Act of 2023.
Section 211 of the Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999 (as contained in section 101(b) of division A of Public Law 105–277; 112 Stat. 2681–88) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or entity of the executive branch after U.S. court;
by striking by a designated national; and

by inserting before the period that was used in connection with a business or assets that were confiscated unless the original owner of the mark, trade name, or commercial name, or the bonafide successor-in-interest has expressly consented;
by inserting or entity of the executive branch after U.S. court; and
by striking by a designated national or its successor-in-interest;

paragraph.text: by inserting after subsection (c) the following:

subsection.text: Subsections (a)(2) and (b) of this section shall apply only if the person or entity asserting the rights knew or had reason to know at the time when the person or entity acquired the rights asserted that the mark, trade name, or commercial name was the same as or substantially similar to a mark, trade name, or commercial name that was used in connection with a business or assets that were confiscated.

paragraph.text: in subsection (e), as so redesignated, by striking In this section: and all that follows through (2) The term and inserting In this section, the term.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives November 13, 2023.
